item.title: How to clone a git repository with its submodules
item.description: This one is pretty simple, you just need to use the --recurse-submodules flag like this: git clone --recurse-submodules git@github.com:loop0/website.git

item.title: How to check supported protocols and ciphers on HTTPS
item.description: In case you need to check which protocols and ciphers are supported on a HTTPS endpoint you can use nmap for that. Just use the following command, replacing loop0.sh for the desired domain. nmap --script ssl-enum-ciphers -p 443 loop0.sh The previous command should give you an output like this: Nmap scan report for loop0.sh (104.24.102.73) Host is up (0.022s latency). Other addresses for loop0.sh (not scanned): 104.24.103.73 2606:4700:3037::6818:6749 2606:4700:3033::6818:6649 PORT STATE SERVICE 443/tcp open https | ssl-enum-ciphers: | TLSv1.
